CatDescriptText: Mr. Alex Delladotti, salesman, 1409 Justin Street, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 7, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that Negroes should push for non-segregated cemeteries, or should they sponsor their own?"  Answer reads: "It would be nicer for Negroes ...their own cemeteries, and then there would be no argument."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Alex Delladotti wearing dark hat, eyeglasses, and patterned necktie, standing in front of bus or trolley
